items.title: [New Atlas] Flame-treated sunscreen keeps the zinc but cuts the smeary white look
items.content_html:
Zinc oxide remains one of the best forms of sun protection thanks to its ability to block both UVB and UVA rays. However, few really appreciate its thick white look â€“ except, maybe, lifeguards in the '80s. UCLA researchers believe they have a solution.

items.title: [Engadget] Watch the NASA SpaceX Crew-12 mission dock with the ISS
items.content_html:
The Crew-12 mission, SpaceXâ€™s 20th human spaceflight, launched at 5:15 AM Eastern on February 13 from Cape Canaveral in Florida. Itâ€™s expected to dock with the International Space Station today, February 14, at 3:15 PM, and you can watch the event below as it happens. By the time the missionâ€™s Dragon capsule docks with the ISS, it will have traveled approximately 34 hours since lift off. Inside are NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, European Space Agencyâ€™s Sophie Adenot and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev.

The four spacefarers are joining the three remaining passengers onboard the ISS after Crew-11 flew back to Earth a month earlier than planned. If youâ€™ll recall, NASA made the decision to cut their mission short after one of the crew members had a medical issue that instruments on the ISS arenâ€™t capable of diagnosing. While the crew member was stable, the agency decided to bring the whole mission home out of an abundance of caution.

Crew-12 will be staying on the ISS for eight months and will conduct a number of scientific experiments, including ones related to human health and ones meant to advance technologies for future missions to the moon and Mars. They will study how pneumonia-causing bacteria can lead to long-term heart damage, for instance, and will also look into how a personâ€™s physical characteristics can affect blood flow during spaceflight. NASAâ€™s live coverage for the docking starts at 1:15 PM.

This article originally appeared on Engadget at https://www.engadget.com/science/space/watch-the-nasa-spacex-crew-12-mission-dock-with-the-iss-180000450.html?src=rss

items.title: [Boing Boing] Caffeinated coffee may stave off dementia
items.content_html:
According to a study comprising 43 years of data on over 130,000 patients, drinking caffeinated coffee was associated with a lower risk of dementia. The study, published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, found that drinking two to three cups of coffee or one to two cups of teaâ€”approximately 300mg of caffeineâ€”reduced dementia risk by 18% and 14%, respectively. — Read the rest

The post Caffeinated coffee may stave off dementia appeared first on Boing Boing.
